meanings.definition: To consider or treat as a problem.
meanings.sent1: She problematized the situation by overthinking every detail.
meanings.sent2: The teacher problematized the math question to challenge the students.
meanings.sent3: He problematized the picnic by forgetting to bring the food.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds problematized our plans for a sunny day at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The detective problematized the case by finding new evidence.

meanings.sent1: The broken printer problematized the office work.
meanings.sent2: Her sudden absence problematized the project timeline.
meanings.sent3: His messy handwriting problematized the note's readability.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected snowstorm problematized our travel plans.
meanings.sent5: The lack of instructions problematized the assembly of the furniture.

meanings.sent1: The student problematized the school policy on uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The article problematized the impact of social media on mental health.
meanings.sent3: His constant complaints problematized the family gathering.
meanings.sent4: The protest problematized the government's decision on the new law.
meanings.sent5: The documentary problematized the environmental effects of deforestation.
